summary: This document is an email chain from December 2020 discussing the approval for a new client to begin therapy. The client is identified as a confirmed victim of Jeffrey Epstein, with treatment scheduled to begin on December 8, 2020. The correspondence involves a licensed psychotherapist seeking confirmation for the victim's status to approve treatment.

persons.name: Mandy
persons.context: Addressed in an email forwarding a request to confirm if a new client is a confirmed victim of Epstein for treatment approval.

persons.name: M.S., L.M.H.C., C.S.A.
persons.context: A licensed psychotherapist certified in sexual abuse trauma who is initiating therapy for a confirmed victim of Jeffrey Epstein, with treatment scheduled to begin on December 8, 2020.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as the perpetrator whose actions caused the victimization for which the new client is seeking therapy.

connections.description: The psychotherapist is treating a client who is a confirmed victim of Jeffrey Epstein's abuse.

events.title: Scheduled therapy session for Epstein victim
events.description: A confirmed victim of Jeffrey Epstein is scheduled to begin therapy treatment with a licensed psychotherapist.

locations.name: Greenaeres, Florida 33463
locations.context: Location of the licensed psychotherapist's practice where therapy for the Epstein victim is being conducted.

keyFacts: A confirmed victim of Jeffrey Epstein reached out for therapy in late 2020, with treatment scheduled to begin on December 8, 2020.
The therapy is being provided by a licensed psychotherapist (M.S., L.M.H.C., C.S.A.) who is certified in sexual abuse trauma.
Internal email correspondence shows staff seeking confirmation of the client's victim status before approving treatment.
The document demonstrates ongoing psychological treatment for Epstein victims years after the main events of the case.
The correspondence highlights procedural steps taken by therapy providers to verify victim status before beginning treatment.
